oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bowman family in pasture
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Keith Bowman and sons in field seeded five years ago to mixture of fescue, orchardgrass and ladino clover. Field will be used for pasture when land comes out of soil bank next year. Located ten miles south of Woodbury.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Grasses; Soil Bank Conservation Reserve Program (U.S.)
Photographic prints;
Fescue;
